label: 房戸
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a subdivision of a larger census unit (ko, gôko) referred to in eighth-century sources. Modern scholars suspect that in the eighth century a bôko may have represented the actual commensal unit residing under a single roof. [戸] [郷戸]
